Award.AbstractNarration:
The principal impact of the present proposal is under Merit Review Criterion 2 of the Proposal Guidelines (NSF 13-589). It provides infrastructure support for scientists to use the vessel and its shared-use instrumentation in support of their NSF-funded oceanographic research projects (which individually undergo separate review by the relevant research program of NSF). The acquisition, maintenance and operation of shared-use instrumentation allows NSF-funded researchers from any US university or lab access to working, calibrated instruments for their research, reducing the cost of that research, and expanding the base of potential researchers.

Program Recommendation
The Program recommends an award of $40,399 for the purchase of the following:
Ashtech ADU800 $10,374
Network Infrastructure Upgrade $5,400
Niskin Bottle Refresh $24,625
$40,399

POR.DRECONTENT:
The OSU MTG was awarded funds to purchase an AshTech ADU800 attitude senor, Network Infrastructure Upgrade and Nisken Bottle Refresh. $10,374 for the AshTech ADU-800, $5,400 for the Network Infrastructure Upgrade and $24,625 for the Nisken Bottle Refresh. All items have been purchased and are currently being used in operations to support science on the R/V Oceanus. Unfortunately, the ADU 800 attitude sensor has not operated as hoped. Shortly after purchasing the system the manufacture discontinued providing service and no longer supported this 800 model anymore. Other ships in the UNOLS fleet have also struggled with integrating this ADU-800’s inot thier vessels. OSU has since purchased the newer version, the ABX-two, to replace the ADU-800 and it is successfully functioning onboard the Oceanus. The Nisken bottle refresh included multiple purchase to upgrade the OSU MTG’s CTD rosette nisken bottles. This has allowed OSU to provide quality and reliable water sampling for science onboard the Oceanus, with sufficient spares. The Network Infrastructure Upgrade included multiple hardware and component purchases to significantly improve the Oceanus’s shipboard network and data collection servers. These improvements have been greatly appreciated by scientists and ships crew. 

The OSU MTG will continue to implement new technologies into their research vessels, thought the operational life of the R/V Oceanus and into their new vessel the R/V Taani.
